description: Construction of a part five, part single-storey building with basement for eleven residential self-contained units (2 x one-bed, 7 x two-beds and 2 x  three-beds) including associated cycle storage, refuse and amenity space (following demolition of existing buildings on the site)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of two years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers 0454-PL-001-0 - Site location plan; 0454-PL-002-0 - Existing and proposed block plan; 0454-PL-211-C - Proposed lower ground floor plan; 0454-PL-212-D - Proposed ground floor plan; 0454-PL-213-C - Proposed first floor plan; 0454-PL-214-D - Proposed second floor plan; 0454-PL-215-D - Proposed third floor plan; 0454-PL-216-B - Proposed fourth floor plan; 0454-PL-217-A - Proposed roof level plan; 0454-PL-221-C - Proposed west elevation; 0454-PL-222-B - Proposed north elevation; 0454-PL-223-C - Proposed south elevation; 0454-PL-224-B - Proposed east elevation; 0454-PL-231-0 - Proposed section AA; 0454-PL-241-0 - Proposed streetscene; 0454-PL-111-0 - Existing lower ground floor plan; 0454-PL-112-0 - Existing ground floor plan; 0454-PL-113-0 - Existing first floor plan; 0454-PL-114-0 - Existing second floor plan; 0454-PL-115-0 - Existing third floor plan; Sustainable Design and Construction Statement, prepared by eb7 ltd., dated 28/09/2016; Internal Daylight Report, Ref: 16-2210, prepared by Syntegra Consulting, dated July 2016; Daylight, Sunlight & Overshadowing Report, Ref: 16-2210, prepared by Syntegra Consulting, dated June 2016; Design and Access Statement, prepared by Urban Infill, dated 29/06/16; Planning Statement, prepared by Maddox Associates, dated July 2016; Transport and Travel Plan Statement, prepared by TTP Consulting, dated June 2016; Phase I - Desk Study, prepared by Pam Brown Associates, dated June 2016; Surface Water Drainage Strategy, prepared by Pitman Associates, dated November 2016; Drainage Assessment From, prepared by Pitman Associates ltd, dated 08/11/2016; Noise Exposure Assessment, ref: 11258-NEA-01-Rev-A, prepared by Clement Acoustics, dated 12/07/16;  Air Quality Assessment, ref; 1322r2, prepared by Redmore Environmental, dated 28/06/16; Email, prepared by Mr. M Plotnek, RE Contamination, dated 14/11/16.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of external materials (brick, mortar and roof tiles) to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development (except ground works and site clearance). The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: Details submitted are not considered acceptable so alternative samples are required to ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 7.1 and 7.6 of the adopted London Plan with minor alterations (2016), policy 1.1(h) of Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | No development (including initial site clearance) shall commence until details of a demolition and construction management plan has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The management plan shall include the following:
1) on-site construction worker parking
2) anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles
3) delivery times
4) vehicle manoeuvring
5) details as to the locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris
6) procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.
7) details of temporary lighting
8) air quality and dust management plan

Prior to the commencement of any site work, all sensitive properties within or surrounding the site shall be notified in writing of the nature and duration of the works to be undertaken, and the name and address of a responsible person to whom enquiries / complaints should be directed. These details shall also be displayed at regular intervals around the site compound. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To protect the living and working conditions of surrounding occupiers and maintain an attractive and safe environment in the locality in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 6.3, 6.11 and 7.14 of the London Plan with minor alterations (2016) and policy 7A of the adopted Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby permitted 20 covered and secure cycle parking spaces shall be installed, be continuously available for use and shall permanently be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided in order to encourage the use of sustainable modes of transport in accordance policy 6.9 and in the London Plan with minor alterations (2016), policy 1.1 (f) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and the Supplementary Planning Document 'Sustainable Transport for New Development' (2013). | Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved sustainability measures and measures to reduce overheating risk detailed within the Sustainable Design and Construction Statement, prepared by eb7 Ltd, dated 28 September 2016 shall be installed, maintained and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change, to secure sustainable development and to reduce the risk of overheating in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan with minor alterations (2016), the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG (2014), policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies 5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | a) Prior to first occupation, the development hereby approved shall incorporate measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 27.15% (equal to 4.76 tonnes CO2/yr) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings, as detailed in the approved Sustainable Design and Construction Statement, prepared by eb7 Ltd, dated 28 September 2016:

-	 energy saving measures to achieve at least an annual carbon dioxide (CO2) emission savings of 1.43 tonnes CO2 which equates to 8.15% CO2 emissions reduction in regulated CO2 emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 base case.

- 	incorporation of solar PV technology with a total panel capacity of at least 7.44kWp to supply at least 6.43MWh of electricity annually and achieve at least annual CO2 emission savings of at least 3.3 tonnes CO2 which equates to 20.69% in CO2 emissions reduction over the Be Lean stage of the Energy Hierarchy.

b) Within three-months of the first occupation of the development hereby approved, Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's], Accompany Advisory Reports and detailed SAP modelling output reports showing clearly the DER and TER from the "as built stage" shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient, to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity, to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health and in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan with minor alterations (2016), the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG (2014), policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), policies 5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | Prior to the first occupation, the development hereby approved shall incorporate and maintain Ultra low-NOx boilers gas boiler(s) for the provision of the space heating and hot water requirements with dry NOx Emissions below 40 mg/kWh. The boilers shall be maintained and permanently be retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 of the London Plan with minor alterations (2016), the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG (2014), policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies 5.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | Prior to first use of the development hereby permitted, suitable devices for monitoring the renewable/low-carbon energy equipment shall be installed.

The monitored data shall be submitted to the local planning authority at daily intervals for a period of three years from final completion. The installation of the monitoring devices should be in a compatible format and the submission of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in Automated Energy (& CO2) Monitoring Platform [AEMP] document.

Reason:  To monitor the effectiveness of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an evidence base on the performance of such equipment in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 5.7 of the London Plan (2016), adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and Development Management DPD (2013).

| The 31mÂ² of first floor roof shall be a biodiversity green roof (plan ref: 0454-213-Rev-C) and shall be installed prior to first occupation. The biodiversity green roof shall incorporate the following:
a) Be biodiversity based with extensive substrate base (depth 80-150mm);
b) Have sufficient depth of soil or growing medium for the relevant planting, including the re-use of any demolition material where feasible;

c) Be planted / seeded with a mix of species within the first planting season following the practical completion of the building works. The seed mix shall be focused on wildflower planting and shall contain no more than 25% sedum;
d) Have relevant efficient and effective drainage and irrigation to sustain the vegetation.

The biodiversity green roof shall not be used as an amenity or sitting out area and shall only be accessed in the case of essential maintenance or repair. The biodiversity green roof shall permanently be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the development provides the maximum possible provision towards the creation of habitats and valuable areas for biodiversity in accordance with policies 5.3, 5.10, 5.11, 5.12 and 7.19 of the London Plan with minor alterations (2016) and policies 1.1 and 1.2 of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | Prior to the commencement of development (included ground works and site clearance) detailed drainage design drawings to demonstrates that SuDS features (soakaways and permeable paving) will be constructed to accommodate volume run-off in accordance with the Drainage Assessment Form and Surface Water Drainage Strategy, prepared by Pitman Associates, dated November 2016, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The approved SuDS features shall be maintained and permanently be retained thereafter.

Reason: To reduce flood risk in accordance with Policy 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and policies 5.12, 5.13 and 7.13 of the London Plan with minor alterations (2016). | Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, acoustic glazing systems and trickle ventilators shall be installed in accordance with the Noise Exposure Assessment, ref: 11258-NEA-01-Rev-A, prepared by Clement Acoustics, dated 12/07/16 and BS EN ISO 140-3:1995. The acoustic glazing systems and trickle ventilators shall be maintained and permanently be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure sufficient sound insulation and to protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan with minor alterations (2016), policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013) and the Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance - SPG 10 Noise and Vibration. | The ventilation system shall provide fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms from the rear of the building at high level in accordance with the Air Quality Assessment, ref; 1322r2, prepared by Redmore Environmental, dated 28/06/16 and shall meet the internal noise criteria of BS8233:2014.  The ventilation system shall be installed prior to the first occupation and shall permanently be retained and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the occupiers of the building in accordance with policies 7.6, 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan with minor alterations (2016), policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013) and the Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | All east facing windows and the ground floor west facing windows on approved plans 0454-PL-224-Rev-B and 0454-PL-221-Rev-C shall contain only obscure glass and shall permanently be retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy 7.6 of the London Plan with minor alterations (2016) and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | Prior to the first occupation of the fourth floor flat hereby approved the railings restricting access to the southern part of the terrace on approved plan 0454-PL-216-Rev-B shall be installed and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy 7.6 of the London Plan with minor alterations (2016) and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).

| The refuse and recycling storage shall be implemented in accordance with the approved plans before the first occupation of any of the dwellings hereby approved and thereafter shall be permanently retained. This area shall not be used for any other purpose.

Reason: To provide adequate refuse and recycling storage to protect the amenities of the area and the living conditions of occupiers of the proposed residential units and the surrounding area in accordance with policies 5.3 of the London Plan with minor alterations (2016) and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).
